title: How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang: 'Everyone knew he never paid for anything'
subhead: The emblematic minister from President François Mitterrand's era was forced to step down as president of the Arab World Institute in Paris. Former allies and rivals have begun to speak out about a man who used his influence and network to maintain a lavish lifestyle.

title: Epstein files unveil sex offender's ties with Kremlin insiders
'The US crisis around ICE evokes the one sparked by the Fugitive Slave Act of 1850'
US remains top export market for French wines and spirits, despite 21% drop
subhead: The French Federation of Wine and Spirits Exporters reported that exports of wine, champagne and cognac fell by 8% in value year-on-year in 2025, to €14.3 billion.

title: Israel's retention of Palestinian bodies: A silent 'hostage-taking'
subhead: More than 670 bodies of West Bank residents have been confiscated by Israel for years, in violation of international law. Their families hope that the return of all the bodies of Israelis held in Gaza by Hamas will prompt the Israeli authorities to soften their stance.

title: New York's 'bodega boys,' the Yemeni shopkeepers caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
subhead: The Trump administration imposed a new entry ban in June 2025 targeting 12 countries, including Yemen. The move has put at risk a community deeply rooted in the local economy: the 'bodega boys,' mostly Yemeni shopkeepers who run corner grocery stores throughout New York.

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
subhead: Two days ahead of a meeting of European Union heads of state and government in Brussels, the French president calls on the 27 member states, in an interview with Le Monde and several other European newspapers, to make joint investments in protecting the environment, as well as in artificial intelligence and quantum technology, to avoid falling behind.

title: Swedish woman files complaint in Paris after recognizing 'rapist' in Epstein files
Paris mayoral election: Searching for middle road, Bournazel rules out alliances
French prosecutors call for witnesses after charging man with sexual abuse of 89 minors
Macron nominates budget minister as top government auditor
Victor Pereira, historian: 'It is clear that far-right ideas have become normalized in Portugal'
'It is illusory to believe that an electoral process can be carried out in Haiti'
Poll: Facing political disarray, French voters turn inward
Rugby legend Serge Blanco launches bid to become Biarritz mayor
Is it ever a good idea to... wear UGGs?
French central bank governor voices concern over slow pace of EU reforms as he steps down
France's municipal elections at risk of foreign interference
2026 Olympics: 'In Russia, even an amateur athlete can become an agent of influence'
Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhead: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Iran: Videos show live ammunition used in crackdown
subhead: The protests that shook the country from late December to mid-January were met with unprecedented violence. Despite an internet blackout, footage verified by Le Monde shows security forces using military-grade weapons against demonstrators, while authorities now openly acknowledge the armed intervention of security forces.

title: Jimmy Lai, a symbol of the end of freedom in Hong Kong
The challenge of action for France's fragile and constrained government
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
